data.title: Good NY Pie in IN!
data.text: Very good selection and options, and the quality is very high. As close to NY style "Pie" as you can get without making the journey to the Big Apple! If you are in the area and looking for a no frills dinner, you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text: This is not your pizza chain pizza.  It is fresh and made to order.  It is in a quaint shop inside a rather old building.  They also have outside seating.

data.title: Great PIZZA and service!
data.text: Was passing through Terre Haute from St.Louis on our way to Fort Wayne and decided to stop and have some pizza. The selection, quality and service was all fantastic. Especially Caleb the store manager was very helpful and courteous. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone in Terre Haute or for those passing through!

data.title: Overpriced and not tasty
data.text: I had a calzone of air.  Not much too it and not tasty.  I cannot recommend this place.  I've heard mixed reviews on this pizza place.  I gather you either like it or hate it.

data.title: Wise Pies rocks
data.text: Wise Pies is one of my favorites in town. Pizza by the slice or the pie. They have a variety of specialty combos or you can customize to your heart's content--we usually get the WOW with olive oil base and added ricotta. The white pizza it delicious as well. Crust is NY style, made from scratch. Heck, they even grate the cheese fresh every day! We often enjoy our pizza in the outdoor seating area, weather permitting. It's covered, so we've even sat out there when it's raining before. Zack and the rest of the crew are a friendly bunch, too. Highly recommend!

data.title: Great pizza!!! Great service!!!
data.text: Pizza was delicious. Clean small restaurant. Extremely friendly staff. GPS location was a little off but you can see it easily on the main road. Highly recommend!

data.title: Amazing Calzones!!
data.text: WOW! This place certainly was worth eating at. The calzone I ate was very well done and delicious. If you are ever in Terre Haute make sure to eat at least one meal here.

data.title: Nice people and great pizza
data.text:
While driving from Chicago to Evansville for business I found myself stuck in some traffic right in front of Wise Pies. Figured I'd take advantage of the time and grab lunch....glad I did!

People at the counter were very nice, pizza and salad were ready quickly and we're both very good. The pizza crust has a crisp yet nicely chewy texture. I think it might be the first pizza I have ever had where I actually ate all the crust. 

If you get a salad, try the Italian dressing. Not sure where they get it or what they do to it but it is really GOOD!

data.title: Good for a quick tasty lunch or for Family dinner.
data.text: Have been at the Third Street location multiple times. The Pizza slices are thin, big, and tasty. The WOW and the barbecue chicken are my family's favorites. Usually not crowded. The calzones have progressively gotten smaller but you can't go wrong with one. The pizzas are big but expect people to be able to eat 2-4 slices because they are thin. Overall a Terre Haute Gem.

data.title: Good New York Style Pizza
data.text: In a former gas station, the pies are very tasty.  The thin crust was very good, although the two pizzas we had were kind of sloppy, (grease?) but easy to fold and eat.  I'd eat there again!  Service was good.  The "Supreme" was kind of scant, but tasty.  The "Carnivore" was the best!  ...but I'm one of those myself!!!

data.title: Local fare.  Fast service.  Great pizza!
data.text: I love local pizza places!  Wise Pies won't disappoint.  Fast service.  Attentive staff and great pizza.  And a great value!  Thin crust and very tasty!

data.title: Favorite pizza place in town
data.text: Best Pizza place in town. Pizza could be hotter. Since their thin crust pizza is very thin, it seems to cool off quickly. Atmosphere is great for a pizza place. Pizza slices are huge.

data.title: Really Good Pizza
data.text: Thin Crust, hand made, delicious. Beer and wine by the mini-bottle. Take out or eat in. Outside seating available.

data.title: Very Good Pizza
data.text: The pizza here is very good. The best I've had in a while. Sometimes they get light on the toppings which can get annoying, especially since the price is higher, but overall a really good pizza.

data.title: First time visitor
data.text: It was our first time visiting and being alone with the kids, I felt a little overwhelmed by the menu, so we went simple with pepperoni and sausage and an order of breadsticks. The kids ate it pretty quickly, I probably should've ordered a bigger pizza! Overall the pizza was good and the staff was prompt to make sure our drinks were refilled. I was expecting a larger crowd for a Friday evening, but it was nice to get in and out quickly.

data.title: Going downhill fast
data.text: I typically eat at Wise Pies once or twice a week and it has consistently been going downhill for the past few weeks.  I go in for lunch around 12:30 and the pizza is significantly limited.  They never have pepperoni, ever.  They won't even throw a couple on your slice.  They have to make it special, which of course means you're paying for it.  When you mention the lack of options, the girls working there are apathetic to say the least.  They just roll their eyes and mumble a sorry.  This afternoon was the worst yet.  There were hardly any slices, girl running the front didn't know what toppings were which.  I get my food and everything is cold.  The breadsticks, the pizza and the marinara sauce.  I probably won't be going back there.

data.title: may be your favorite
data.text: This is a nice pizza place that is easy to get in and out. The pizzas taste ok but there is something in the ingredients that does not set well with my wife or myself. May you have better luck.

data.title: Wise Pies South (2961 South 3rd)
data.text: After a 10 hour day on the road, we were looking for something convenient to the Hampton Inn.  Wanting to stay away from chain pizza shops, we opted for an 18" Pepperoni & Banana Pepper w/extra cheese pizza.  When I picked it up, it seemed awfully light for an 18" pizza.  The crust is very thin which pleased my wife.  While that may have been part of its "lightness", I felt the toppings were somewhat lacking.  It's a good thing I ordered extra cheese, or I may not have had any at all.  One of my slices only had two banana peppers on it.  One of my wife's slices had a banana pepper stem (one of our pet peeves).  Come on folks.....look at what you're doing and take some pride in making a great pie.  The flavor was good, I would just have liked more substance for $20+.

data.title: Great local pizza joint
data.text: Wise pies is a locally owned company and they make great pizza. The section of types of pies is interesting and the ingredients seem fresh. The service is pretty good, especially if you shoes to get a slice from the pizzas that are already made. Would recommend to anyone who loves pizza.

data.title: Great pizza for a fair price
data.text: Great New York style pizza. They sell it by the slice as well as the whole pie. Fresh ingredients and the crust is made right there. Small dining room but has some outside seating.
